duties_responsibilities.duty: Conduct initial case development and respond to dispute resolution inquiries received through the CIS Helpline and CIS email.
Outreach to the other side of the dispute, including those who may have knowledge of the situation, such as housing case managers, property managers, social workers, etc., when appropriate.
Clarify issues, concerns, needs, and interests of all parties involved and complete City and County Client Intake Forms for residents and tenants who qualify for free services.
Provide referrals to legal assistance and social service supports, when appropriate, and prepare written summaries of dispute resolution inquiries.
Attend mediations as support to the participants and the mediator, and perform aftercare check-ins with participants, post mediation.
Assist with scheduling meetings and facilitation and/or mediation, assist with in-person visits to promote CIS, and appearances at public events.
Support outreach of the CIS program and assist managing CIS database functions as needed, and help coordinate referral resources.

education_certification.credential: At least 20 hours of mediation training and/or equivalent experience.
